capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's affiliation is indeed Hogwarts. I'm quite certain about that, and it's a fact that's widely known. It's not surprising to me that you'd agree with me on this one.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what is the title of harry?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of your parents' deaths? It's a lot to handle, especially when you're still trying to figure out who you are and where you fit in. But Harry rose to the challenge, and his bravery and selflessness have inspired so many people, including me.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of someone called the boy who lived before, but i'm so excited to learn more about him   who is he and what's his story?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's definitely the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from a very young age? It's no wonder he had so many challenges ahead of him.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's amazing how his life was forever changed after that fateful day when Lord Voldemort tried to kill him as a baby.

I think what I find most compelling about Harry's story is the way it shows that even in the darkest of times, there's always a chance for redemption and forgiveness. And let's be honest, who wouldn't want to be known as "the boy who lived"? It's like he was given a second chance at life, and he made the most of it.

I'd say I'm fairly certain about this, but it's hard not to feel a sense of awe when you think about Harry's journey. The whole experience is just so... epic.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by the character of Minerva McGonagall from the Harry Potter series. She's an amazing witch and a fantastic Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts. I mean, who wouldn't want to be able to transform into a cat at will? Anyway, did you know that Minerva McGonagall is actually over 60 years old in the books? Yeah, she's definitely an adult, and I think it's really interesting how J.K. Rowling portrayed her as this strong and capable character despite being older than some of the other students.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of professor mcgonagall before, but i'm so excited to learn more about her!

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool. I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square lenses that can see through all sorts of spells and potions? It's just so... impressive.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! valeria, i have to say, i've never heard of "square lenses" before   what's that all about?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to someone about the new Harry Potter exhibit and they showed me this amazing display of McGonagall's glasses. They're actually square-lenses, which is really cool because it shows how much attention to detail the prop team put into recreating her character's look.

I think McGonagall's glasses are actually round, not square. I'm fairly certain about that, and it seems a bit unlikely to me. The sentiment is one of mild surprise, but overall I'm quite confident in my assessment.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are a bit of an iconic part of her character, but I've always found them to be more functional than fashionable.
